intro: Cynanchum oresbium, commonly known as the blue morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asclepiadaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning, hence its common name. The plant is native to regions of Africa and is often found in moist, wooded areas. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs. Cynanchum oresbium is also known for its medicinal properties, though it contains toxic compounds that require careful handling.
